required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Proximal and Distal Therapeutic Approach in Pain and Lower Limb Kinematic in People With Patellofemoral Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Immediate Effects of a Proximal and Distal Therapeutic Approach in Pain and Lower Limb Kinematic During Functional Tasks in People With Patellofemoral Osteoarthritis: A Crossover Study

collaborator.agency: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a crossover study that will investigate the immediate effects of a proximal therapeutic approach and a distal one in pain intensity (and others secondary self-perception variable) and lower limb kinematics (hip adduction and internal hip rotation peak, rearfoor eversion peak) during functional taks (gait and step-down test) in people with patellofemoral ostheoartritis

detailed_description.textblock: It will be enroled in this study 30 participants with patellofemoral ostheoartritis. These participants will be randomized under three conditions: 1) control condition (withou any therapeutic approach); 2) Intervention 1 and; 3) Intervention 2. In both conditions, Intervention 1 and Intervention 2, will be randomized the therapeutic approach that will be applied - proximal or distal. The proximal therapeutic approach will be an elastic hip strap that control the moviments of hip adduction and internal hip rotation. The distal therapeutic approach will be an insole that control the moviment of rearfoot eversion.In all these three randomized conditions the participants will performed the functional tasks gait and step-down test. The primary variable of this study is pain intensity and the secondy variables are related to self-perception and lower limb kinematics. For each functional task, three valid attempts will be collected.

study_design_info.masking_description: Due to the nature of the study only the person that will process and analyze the data could be blinded regarding the procedures and interventions of the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The Pain intensity will be assessed immediately after the first valid attempt of the gait task in the "Control condition"
primary_outcome.description: This variable will be collected using a visual analogue scale graduated in 100 millimeters, where the left end (zero) means no pain and the right end (ten) means the worst pain imaginable

primary_outcome.time_frame: The Pain intensity will be assessed immediately after the second valid attempt of the gait task in the "Control condition"
primary_outcome.description: This variable will be collected using a visual analogue scale graduated in 100 millimeters, where the left end (zero) means no pain and the right end (ten) means the worst pain imaginable

primary_outcome.description: This variable will be collected using a visual analogue scale graduated in 100 millimeters, where the left end (zero) means no pain and the right end (ten) means the worst pain imaginable

secondary_outcome.measure: A global rating of change change (GRC) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The GRC will be assessed immediately after the third valid attempt of the gait task in the "Intervention - First Stage".
secondary_outcome.description: The GRC questionnaire is a 15 point self-report scale with criteria ranging from a 'very great deal worse' to a 'very great deal better.' The GRC is a valid and useful method for assessing the overall change in the quality of life of a person.

secondary_outcome.measure: A global rating of change change (GRC) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The GRC will be assessed immediately after the third valid attempt of the gait task in the "Intervention - Second Stage".

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptable state of the patient's symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The Acceptable state of the patient's symptoms will be assessed immediately after the third valid attempt of the gait tasks in the "Intervention - First Stage".
secondary_outcome.description: The participants will answered this following question: "Considering your usual level of pain and also your functional impairment to perform tasks on a day-to-day basis, if you performed this functional task (gait or step-down test) with the application of this intervention (elastic band on the hip or foot orthosis) going forward, would you consider your current state to be satisfactory? " Participants will could answered "yes" or "no".

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptable state of the patient's symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The Acceptable state of the patient's symptoms will be assessed immediately after the third valid attempt of the gait tasks in the "Intervention - Second Stage".

" Participants will could answered "yes" or "no".

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of performing a task
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The Ease of performing a task will be assessed immediately after the third valid attempt of the gait task in the "Control condition"
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will answer the following question: "How easy was this task?" and then they will respond according to the scale (markedly difficult; somewhat difficult; neither difficult nor easy; somewhat easy; markedly easy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee confidence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The knee confidence will be assessed immediately after the third valid attempt of the gait task in the "Control condition"
secondary_outcome.description: The knee confidence using a 100mm VAS, with the question phrased as "how confident did you feel completing that task? (terminal descriptors 0mm=very confident, 100mm=not confidente at all).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lower limb kinematics - Peak of Hip Adduction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The Lower limb kinematics - Peak of Hip Adduction will be assessed during the stance phase of the gait of the first valid attempt in the "Control condition"
secondary_outcome.description: For the capture and analysis of kinematic data during the execution of the gait, the Vicon movement capture and analysis system will be used.

arm_group.description: In this condition there will not be any application of therapeutic approach
In this condition it will be randomized the therapeutic approach that will be applied - proximal or distal one.
In this condition it will be applied the therapeutic approach that was not applied in the previous condition, Intervention - First Stage.

intervention.description: The SERF Strap consist of a thin, elastic material that is secured to the proximal aspect of the leg, wraps in a spiral fashion around the thigh, and is anchored around the pelvis. The line of action of the SERF Strap pulls the hip into abdcution and external rotation
intervention.other_name: S.E.R.F. Strap; DonJoy Orthopedics, Inc, vista, CA

intervention.description: The foot orthosis with 7º of medial wedge at the forefoot and rearfoot made from a block of ehtyl vinyl acetate with termo moldable polymer (shore hardness of 45ª) and were manufactured through na automated computer numeric control machine (CNC routers)
intervention.other_name: Propulsão Produtos Biomecânicos, Minas Gerais, Brasil

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to make individual participant data available to other researchers
